description: This course explores the diverse modes of inquiry in the discipline of political science. Broadly centered around the question, "How do you know?," students focus on different methods of locating and collecting data, reviewing political texts and contested concepts, and constructing theoretical explanations of political phenomena. Offered each semester. Also counts toward environmental studies major (social science emphasis) and management studies concentration. Prerequisite: one previous course in department. Non-majors may register with permission of instructor.
name: Analyzing Politics
notes: For Political Science majors only. Others may register with permission of the
instructor. Open only to rising juniors and sophomores.
prerequisites: one previous course in department. Non-majors may register with permission of instructor.
title: Analyzing Politics and Policies
